parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether or not any data was collected for the event topic.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is a field that can be used on any Events CRF to indicate whether or not there is data to record. Used primarily as a data cleaning field, this provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. If the response to YES/NO is planned to be submitted in the SDTM submission datasets, this CDASH variable should not be used and the appropriate CDASH variable should be used instead (e.g., --OCCUR).
cdashModelFields.label: Any [Event]
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
cdashModelFields.name: --YN
cdashModelFields.questionText: Has the subject had any [event topic(s)/term/name] ([study specific time frame])?; [Was/Were] (there) any [event topic(s)] (reported) ([study specific time frame])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The topic variable for an event observation, which is the reported or pre-specified name of the event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Typically, --TERM collects the verbatim text for an event. If the term is preprinted/pre-specified, the value can be populated into the --TERM variable as a hidden field (e.g., if Headache is printed on an AE CRF, "Headache" should be stored in AETERM). The CDASH field --TERM can also be used to collect any free-text values linked to the sponsor-standardized value collected in the CDASH field --DECOD. For example, --DECOD may have a value of "OTHER" and the associated free-text event topic is collected in --TERM. In this scenario, the Item prompt "Specify Other" may be used.
cdashModelFields.label: Reported Term
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --TERM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [event topic/term/name]?; If --DECOD (is selected), [explain/specify/provide (more) detail(s)]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The dictionary or sponsor-defined standardized text description of the topic variable; --TERM; or the modified topic variable (-- MODIFY), if applicable.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: When populated by a coding dictionary (e.g., MedDRA), Question Text and Prompt may not be applicable. This is equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT) in MedDRA. CDISC Controlled terminology (NCOMPLT) is used for the DS domain only. The CDASH field --DECOD may be used to collect standardized pre-specified values (CDISC Controlled Terminology or sponsor-defined terminology) on a CRF. The CDASH field --TERM can be used to collect any free-text values linked to the sponsor-standardized value. For example, the CDASH field --DECOD may have a value of "OTHER" and the associated free-text event topic is collected in the CDASH field --TERM.
cdashModelFields.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. If sponsors use a dictionary to code --TERM, they should provide the dictionary name and version in the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
cdashModelFields.name: --DECOD
cdashModelFields.prompt: (Standardized) [Event/Event Topic] (at the EPOCH/Study Specific Time Frame)
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [event/event topic] (at the EPOCH/study specific time frame)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. --SCAT can only be used if there is --CAT. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "category" can be included as the column header. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata table and in the SDTMIG.
cdashModelFields.label: Category
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --CAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the category (of the [--TERM/event topic])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A sub-division of the --CAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. --SCAT can only be used if there is --CAT. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata table and in the SDTMIG.
cdashModelFields.label: Subcategory
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --SCAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the subcategory (of the [--TERM/event topic])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, is pre-specified on a CRF.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: For pre-specified events, --PRESP is a hidden field on a CRF defaulted to Y, or can be added during SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both pre-specified events and free-text events, the value of --PRESP should be Y for all pre-specified events and null for events reported as free text.
cdashModelFields.label: Pre-Specified
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --PRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether the pre-specified event or the group of events occurred when the occurrence of the specific event or group of events is solicited.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: If the term is preprinted/pre-specified, then the value is mapped into the --TERM variable (e.g., if Headache is printed on an AE CRF, "Headache" should be stored in AETERM).
cdashModelFields.label: Occurrence
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --OCCUR
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Did/Does/Was] the subject (have) [--TERM] (after/before [study-specific time frame]) ?; [Did/Is] (the) [pre-specified --TERM/--DECOD] [occur/occurring]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The variable used to indicate whether data are available, by having the site record the value as "Yes" or "No".
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Using --PERF, a response of "Y" or "N" can be collected. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the --STAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE". --PERF can be used instead of --STAT when a Y/N response list is needed for implementation. Example: Were medical history conditions assessed?
cdashModelFields.label: [Observation] Performed
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable --STAT to indicate when a pre-specified event was not assessed. For use with pre-specified events, when the CDASH variable --PERF="N", the value of the STDM variable --STAT is "NOT DONE". If --PERF= "Y", --STAT is null.
cdashModelFields.name: --PERF
cdashModelFields.questionText: (Were/Was) (the) [event topic] [answered/done/assessed/evaluated/available]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site record the value as "Not Done".
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: A Not Done checkbox indicates the data is not available/question was not asked. Typically, there would be 1 checkbox for each pre-specified event. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is intended to be blank.
cdashModelFields.label: Completion Status
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. If collected on the CRF, the Origin (column in the Define-XML) = "CRF"; if populated by the sponsor from other sources (e.g., free text, a sponsor-defined listing for --REASND), Origin = "DERIVED".
cdashModelFields.name: --STAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: Was the [event topic] not [answered/done/assessed/evaluated]?; Indicate if ([event topic] was) not [answered/assessed/done/evaluated].

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An explanation for why the assessment/evaluation/question was not answered, collected, or done.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data was not done/not collected may be chosen from a select list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When --REASND is used, --STAT should also be populated in the SDTM dataset.
cdashModelFields.label: Reason Not Done
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --REASND
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the reason that the ([data/information/sponsor-defined phrase]) was not [answered/collected/done/evaluated/assessed]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This may be preprinted or collected. --LOC is used only to specify the anatomical location. --LAT, --DIR, --PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
cdashModelFields.label: Location of Event
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --LOC
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the anatomical location (of the [--TERM/event topic])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the laterality of the location of the --TERM. This may be preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.
cdashModelFields.label: Laterality
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --LAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the side (of the anatomical location of the event)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the directionality of the location of the --TERM (e.g., ANTERIOR, LOWER, PROXIMAL). This may be preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.
cdashModelFields.label: Directionality
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DIR
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the directionality (of the anatomical location)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the portion or totality of the location of the --TERM. This may be preprinted or collected.
cdashModelFields.label: Portion or Totality
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --PORTOT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the portion or totality of the (anatomical location) involved?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The party accountable for the transferable object (e.g., device, specimen) as a result of the activity performed in the associated --TERM variable.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. The party could be an individual (e.g., subject), an organization (e.g., sponsor), or a location that is a proxy for an individual or organization (e.g., site). This is usually a somewhat general term that is further identified in the -- PRTYID variable (e.g., SITE, SPONSOR, SUBJECT).
cdashModelFields.label: Accountable Party
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --PARTY
cdashModelFields.questionText: Who [is/was] the accountable party?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Identification of the specific party accountable for the transferable object (e.g., device, specimen) after the action in -- TERM is taken.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Used in conjunction with --PARTY. This identifier is defined by the sponsor.
cdashModelFields.label: Identification of Accountable Party
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --PRTYID
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the accountable party identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The severity or intensity of the event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: In the AE domain, AESEV uses CDISC Controlled Terminology (AESEV).
cdashModelFields.label: Severity/Intensity
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --SEV
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the severity (of the event topic)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66767

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A description of the action taken with study treatment as a result of the event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: How to handle multiple actions taken is sponsor-specific decision. This variable is not to be used for actions taken with devices.See the SDTMIG-MD for information on reporting multiple actions, or actions with multiple devices.
cdashModelFields.label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --ACN
cdashModelFields.questionText: What action was taken with study treatment?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether this event met the definition of serious.
cdashModelFields.label: Serious Event
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --SER
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] [the event topic/it] serious?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A description of other action(s) taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of the study treatment.
cdashModelFields.label: Other Action Taken
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --ACNOTH
cdashModelFields.questionText: What other action(s) [were/was] taken?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A description of the action taken, with respect to a device used in a study, which may or may not be the device under study, as a result of the event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This variable is intended to be used like --ACN, but refers to device rather than study treatment. See the SDTMIG-MD for information on reporting multiple actions, or actions with multiple devices.
cdashModelFields.label: Action Taken with Device
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --ACNDEV
cdashModelFields.questionText: What action was taken with the device used in the study?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The investigator's opinion as to the relationship of the event to the study treatment.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. ICH E2A and E2B examples include NOT RELATED, UNLIKELY RELATED, POSSIBLY RELATED, RELATED.
cdashModelFields.label: Causality
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --REL
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] this event related to study treatment?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A description of the investigator's opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study treatment.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: May be reported as free text. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE".
cdashModelFields.label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --RELNST
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the relationship to non-study treatment?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A description of the pattern of the event over time.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology
cdashModelFields.label: Pattern of Event
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --PATT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the pattern of the event over time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A description of the outcome of an event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: CDISC Controlled Terminology (OUT) is used in the AE domain.
cdashModelFields.label: Outcome of Event
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --OUT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the outcome (of the event/event topic)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether a concomitant or additional was treatment given because of the occurrence of the event.
cdashModelFields.label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --CONTRT
cdashModelFields.questionText: Was a concomitant or additional treatment given (due to this [event])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A description of toxicity quantified by --TOXGR (e.g., NCI CTCAE Short Name).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: If used, --TOX would be populated with the decoded value from --TOXGR. For example, if --TERM is HYPERTENSION, and --TOXGR is "1", --TOX is populated with "Prehypertension (systolic BP 120 - 139 mm Hg or diastolic BP 80 - 89 mm Hg)".
cdashModelFields.label: Toxicity
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.
cdashModelFields.name: --TOX

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The toxicity grade, using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Refer to ICH E3 guidelines for CSR, Section 12.2.4. CTCAE grade is commonly used in oncology studies although it can also be used elsewhere. Other published toxicity-like scales may be used.
cdashModelFields.label: Toxicity Grade
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.
cdashModelFields.name: --TOXGR
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [NCI CTCAE/Name of Scale] grade?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether the event is ongoing as of a given timepoint when no end date is provided.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH field --ONGO allows specific question text/prompt about events ending prior to the given timepoint. Select the appropriate text when designing the CRF. This may also included in the CRF title or instructions. Used in conjunction with either a reference timepoint (--ENTPT, --ENRTPT) or in conjunction with the study reference period (described as RFSTDTC to RFENDTC). May also be used as a tick/checkbox. See CDASHIG Section 3.7 for more information.
cdashModelFields.label: Ongoing Event
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as --ENRF or --ENRTPT. When populating --ENRF, or --ENRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field --ONGO is "Y", a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When --ONGO refers to the study reference period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTM variable --ENRF should be populated. When --ONGO is compared to another time point, the SDTM variables --ENRTPT and --ENTPT should be used. Note: --ENRTPT must refer to the time point anchor described in --ENTPT.
cdashModelFields.name: --ONGO
cdashModelFields.prompt: Ongoing (as of the [Study-Specific Timepoint or Period])
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] the [--TERM/event topic] ongoing (as of [the study-specific timepoint or period])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether the event caused the subject to discontinue from the study.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: May be used to create a RELREC to link the record to a Disposition record (see SDTMIG). The sponsor could submit "--DIS" in a SUPP-- dataset as a value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM is "--DIS" and SUPP--.QLABEL is "Caused Study Discontinuation", if appropriate.
cdashModelFields.label: Caused Study Discontinuation
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create a RELREC to link Event and Disposition records. The sponsor could submit "--DIS" in a SUPP-- dataset as a value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM is "--DIS" and SUPP--.QLABEL is "Caused Study Discontinuation", if appropriate.
cdashModelFields.name: --DIS
cdashModelFields.questionText: Did the [--TERM/event topic] cause the subject to be discontinued from the study?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication that the disease/symptoms were under control at the time of data collection.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The conditions would typically be defined in the protocol. For example, a sponsor may ask the site to indicate whether a subject's hypertension is under control at the time of enrollment in the study.
cdashModelFields.label: Disease or Symptom Under Control
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM is "--CTRL" and SUPP--.QLABEL is "Disease or Symptom Under Control". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables (NSVs) in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --CTRL
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] the [--TERM/event topic] under control?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A description of the reason for the event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: To ensure data quality, it is recommended that sponsors develop controlled terminology. Reason for Health Care Encounters could include LACK OF EFFICACY, ADVERSE EVENT, CHEMOTHERAPY, PHYSICAL THERAPY, INDICATION UNDER STUDY, NOT INDICATION UNDER STUDY.
cdashModelFields.label: Reason for the Event
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM is "--REAS" and SUPP--.QLABEL is "Reason for the Event". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --REAS
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the reason (for the [--TERM/event topic])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A free-text comment.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: If an additional free-text field is needed to provide a comment about a particular record, use the COVAL(n) field to collect the free text, and associate the free-text comment with the original record using SDTM variables RDOMAIN, IDVAR, IDVARVAL, COREF. See the SDTMIG for more information.
cdashModelFields.label: Comment
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, the CDASH variable COVAL maps to the SDTM variable COVAL (COVAL2, COVAL3) in the CO domain. Associate the free-text comment in the CO domain with the original record using RDOMAIN, IDVAR, IDVARVAL, COREF.
cdashModelFields.name: COVAL
cdashModelFields.prompt: [abbreviated version of the protocol-specified targeted question]
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Protocol-specified Targeted Question]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: If the value for --TERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF; sponsors will populate this through the coding process. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package.
cdashModelFields.label: Modified Reported Term
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --MODIFY

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The dictionary-derived text description of the lowest level term.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process (e.g., using MedDRA). Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package.
cdashModelFields.label: Lowest Level Term
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code the event utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
cdashModelFields.name: --LLT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The dictionary-derived code for the lowest level term.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process (e.g., using MedDRA). Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package.
cdashModelFields.label: Lowest Level Term Code
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code the event utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
cdashModelFields.name: --LLTCD

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The dictionary-derived code for the preferred term.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process (e.g., using MedDRA). Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package.
cdashModelFields.label: Preferred Term Code
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code the event utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
cdashModelFields.name: --PTCD

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The dictionary-derived text description of the primary system organ class (SOC).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process (e.g., using MedDRA). Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package.

description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2021-06-25)
label: Events
name: Events
